travelers.notes: Business partners (travel agents) and BFFs. Both in 50s, experienced travelers, foodies, good physical health. First time to Portugal. Scouting trip to learn destination for future client sales.

preferences.vibe: Pack it full — culture, food, scenic villages, beaches, shopping. Dual purpose: personal adventure + business reconnaissance.
preferences.budget: Cost-conscious with selective splurges for right experiences
preferences.mobility: No restrictions. Kim prefers shorter car rides (no long drives).
preferences.transportation: Rental car for flexibility + trains + small group tours. Keep driving segments short.
mustHave: Shopping - fashion for Susie, unique/off-beaten-path for Kim
See key tourist spots to understand for future clients
preferences.kimPreferences: Mountains, villages, hiking, unique finds, shorter drives

locations.name: Évora or Óbidos
locations.purpose: Stop en route, off-beaten-path village feel

locations.name: Porto

locations.name: Sintra or Cascais
locations.purpose: Fairy-tale palaces OR beach town before departure

rentalCar.notes: For flexibility, but keep segments short. Combine with trains.

trains.notes: Lisbon-Porto train is scenic and avoids long drive

footwear: Comfortable walking shoes essential - cobblestone streets everywhere
Stylish sneakers or supportive flats work perfectly
Avoid flip-flops which mark you as a tourist
clothing: Well-fitted jeans, chinos, capris, or casual dresses
Layers essential - light jacket, cardigan, or versatile scarf
Modest tops for church visits - shoulders should be covered

suggestions: Nice blouse or sweater with dark jeans or tailored pants
Casual dress with cardigan or blazer
Comfortable but stylish low heels, ankle boots, or dressy flats
avoid: Athletic wear, shorts, or overly casual clothing at dinner

generalTips: Stick to neutrals and earthy tones - black, navy, olive, cream blend in well
Portuguese women tend toward classic, understated elegance over flashy
Versatile scarf doubles as style piece and cover-up for churches
Pack pieces that mix and match easily
packingGuide.proTip: A lightweight, wrinkle-resistant wardrobe will serve you well. Choose fabrics that travel easily and can be dressed up or down!

openQuestions: Confirm itinerary flow: Lisbon → Évora/Óbidos → Porto → Sintra/Cascais?
